subject: Re: [junit] How to avoid running a test class multiple times
msgSnippet: What happened to #1? ... Have you tested it as written?  There should only ever be one of the internal RunnerBuilders constructed, if my brain s on right, so
messageBody:
What happened to #1?

On Thu, Jan 27, 2011 at 5:55 PM, John Cortell <john.cortell@...> wrote:
> On Thu, Jan 27, 2011 at 4:16 PM, John Cortell <john.cortell@...>wrote:
>
>> 2. [runtime issue] The collection (Set) has to be a instance field of
>> OnceOnlySuite, not the anonymous inner RunnerBuilder(), since the latter's
>> instances are ephemeral.
>>
>
> Correction. The Set needs to be a *static* field of OnceOnlySuite since you
> are not allowed to reference an instance field while explicitly invoking a
> constructor.

Have you tested it as written? There should only ever be one of the
internal RunnerBuilders constructed, if my brain's on right, so it
should work. If it doesn't, please let me know so I can adjust my
brain.

David Saff

>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
